data.name: plServerTime.Help
data.value: The current date and time for the web server

data.name: plWebFarm.Help
data.value: Is this site using a Web Farm.

data.name: plVersion.Help
data.value: The application version you are running

data.name: plDataProvider.Help
data.value: The provider name which is identified as the default data provider in the web.config file

data.name: plFramework.Help
data.value: The .NET Framework version which the application is running on - specified through IIS

data.name: plIdentity.Help
data.value: The Windows user account under which the application is running. This is the account which needs to be granted folder permissions on the server.

data.name: plIPAddress.Help
data.value: The IP Address of the Server.

data.name: plPermissions.Help
data.value: The code access permissions available in the hosting environment.

data.name: plApplicationPath.Help
data.value: The relative location of the application in relation to the root of the site.

data.name: plApplicationMapPath.Help
data.value: The physical location of the site root on the server.

data.name: plGUID.Help
data.value: The globally unique identifier which can be used to identify this application.

data.name: plSMTPEnableSSL.Help
data.value: Used for SMTP services that require secure connection (usually not needed)

data.name: SpecifyHostEmailMessage.Text
data.value: You Must Specify The Host Email Address

data.name: plSchedulerMode.Help
data.value: The Timer Method maintains a separate thread to execute scheduled tasks while the worker process is alive. Alternatively, the Request Method executes tasks when HTTP Requests are made. You can also disable the scheduler by selecting Disabled.

data.name: BasicSettingsHelp.Text
data.value: Enter basic settings for your Hosting Account

data.name: plHostTitle.Help
data.value: Enter the name of your Hosting Account

data.name: plHostURL.Help
data.value: Enter the URL of your Hosting Account

data.name: plHostEmail.Help
data.value: Enter a support email adress for your Hosting Account

data.name: plHostSkin.Help
data.value: Select the default skin to use for your sites

data.name: plHostContainer.Help
data.value: Select the default container to use for your sites

data.name: AdvancedSettingsHelp.Text
data.value: Enter advanced settings for your Hosting Account

data.name: plCopyright.Help
data.value: Select this to add the DotNetNuke copyright credits to the Page Source

data.name: plUseCustomErrorMessages.Help
data.value: Select this to use Custom Error Messages

data.name: plProcessor.Help
data.value: Select a Payment processor for accepting payments from Client sites

data.name: plUserId.Help
data.value: Enter your UserId for the Payment Processor

data.name: plPassword.Help
data.value: Enter your Pasword for the Payment Processor

data.name: plHostFee.Help
data.value: Enter the base fee for site hosting

data.name: plHostCurrency.Help
data.value: Select the currency for your fees

data.name: plDemoPeriod.Help
data.value: Enter the number of days for a demo trial account

data.name: plDemoSignup.Help
data.value: Select whether you will allow users to signup for a demo

data.name: plHostSpace.Help
data.value: Enter the amount of file space allowed for an account

data.name: plSMTPServer.Help
data.value: Enter the SMTP Server Address. You can also specify an alternate port by adding a colon and the port number (e.g. smtp.googlemail.com:587). Enter the SMTP server name only to use default port number (25)

data.name: plSMTPAuthentication.Help
data.value: Enter the SMTP Server Authentication method ( default = Anonymous )

data.name: plSMTPUsername.Help
data.value: Enter the Username for the SMTP Server

data.name: plSMTPPassword.Help
data.value: Enter the Password for the SMTP Server

data.name: plControlPanel.Help
data.value: You can specify an alternative control to use for Page Administration

data.name: plFileExtensions.Help
data.value: Enter the allowable file extensions (separated by commas)

data.name: plSkinUpload.Help
data.value: Select whether Skin Upload is restricted to the "Host" Account or can be done by Site Administrators

data.name: plCache.Help
data.value: Set the length of time that objects remain in the cache

data.name: plProxyUsername.Help
data.value: Enter the User Name for the Proxy Server

data.name: plProxyPassword.Help
data.value: Enter the Password for the Proxy Server

data.name: plWebRequestTimeout.Help
data.value: Enter a time out value for a Web Request

data.name: plSiteLogBuffer.Help
data.value: Enter the number of Items in the Site Log Buffer

data.name: plSiteLogHistory.Help
data.value: Enter the number of Days of activity to keep in the Site Log

data.name: plUsersOnline.Help
data.value: You can optionally enable the Users Online feature

data.name: plUsersOnlineTime.Help
data.value: Enter the length of the Users Online Buffer

data.name: plSiteLogStorage.Help
data.value: Select the storage location for the Site Log

data.name: ModuleHelp.Text
data.value:
About Host Settings

The Super User can manage the configuration settings which apply to the entire site.

data.name: plLogBuffer.Help
data.value: Checking this will cause log entries to be logged to memory and then purged regularly to the data store. Unchecking it will cause log entries to be written immediately.

data.name: plAutoAccountUnlock.Help
data.value: After an account is locked out due to unsuccessful login attempts, it can be automatically unlocked with a successful authentication after a certain period of time has elapsed. Enter the number of minutes to wait until the account can be automatically unlocked. Enter "0" to disable the auto-unlock feature.

data.name: plCacheMethod.Help
data.value: Memory caching provides the most flexibility and is the highest performance method however it also consumes the most system resources. Disk caching is the least expensive on resources but does not offer any flexibility.

data.name: plHelpUrl.Help
data.value: Enter the URL for the Online Help you will be providing. If you leave the entry blank then no Online Help will be offered for the Admin/Host areas of DotNetNuke.

data.name: plEnableHelp.Help
data.value: You can enable or disable the Online Help Action Menu for Modules. If enabled, you will need to provide the Help URL for the module, in the Module Definitions, although this may have been provided by the developer of the module.

data.name: plCacheability.Help
data.value: Sets the Cache-Control HTTP header value for authenticated users.

data.name: plUpgrade.Help
data.value: Select this option if you would like the application to check if there are upgrades available.

data.name: plAvailable.Help
data.value: Displays an icon if a new version of the application is available

data.name: plLog.Help
data.value: Allows you to view the database upgrade log for a specific version

data.name: plAutoSync.Help
data.value: Check this box to automatically synchronize the file system.

data.name: plPageQuota.Help
data.value: You can specify a maximum number of pages per website.

data.name: plUserQuota.Help
data.value: You can specify a maximum number of users per website.

data.name: plCompression.Help
data.value: Select the type of Http Compression to use.

data.name: plPageState.Help
data.value: Select the mode to use to persist a page's state. This can either be a hidden field on the Page (Default) or in Memory (Cache). ** Warning: Memory page state persistence can cause Ajax issues **

data.name: plWhitespace.Help
data.value: Select this to remove excess white space from the response sent to the client - this will result in a smaller download (10-15%) but it will make the html less readable.

data.name: plExcludedPaths.Help
data.value: Enter a list of excluded Paths.

data.name: plWhitespaceFilter.Help
data.value: Enter a Regular Expression filter for removing whitespace.

data.name: valHostFee.Error
data.value: Invalid fee, needs to be a currency value!

data.name: LogEmpty.Text
data.value: The log file is empty for the script version specified. This generally indicates that the script ran successfully.

data.name: NoLog.Text
data.value: A log file does not exist for the script version specified. This generally indicates that the script was never executed.

data.name: EmailErrorMessage.Text
data.value:
There has been an error trying to send the test email. The error is:
{0}

data.name: plAJAX.Help
data.value: Check this box to enable AJAX support.

data.name: plHostDefaultDocType.Help
data.value: Sets the fallback Skin Doctype for webpages. This is used if the Skin does not define the DocType.

data.name: plRememberMe.Text
data.value: Enable Remember me on login controls?

data.name: plRememberMe.Help
data.value: Sets the remember me checkbox on login controls. If remember me is allowed, users can create cookies that are persisted over multiple visits.

data.name: valFileExtensions.Error
data.value: File Extensions can only include letters, numbers and the underscore, separated by commas.

data.name: plNotifyUpgrade.Help
data.value: If checked the Host user will be notified of Updates by email.

data.name: plAdminContainer.Help
data.value: The selected container will be applied to all edit mode (ctl=) modules on your sites.

data.name: plAdminSkin.Help
data.value: The selected skin will be applied to all edit mode (ctl=) pages on your sites.

data.name: plJQueryDebugVersion.Help
data.value: If checked, then the standard jQuery script file is used. If unchecked, then a minified version is used which significantly reduces the size of the javascript file, but decreases readability of the javascript.

data.name: plJQueryHostUrl.Help
data.value: This is the full URL for the jQuery script. By default this is set to the latest jQuery minified script hosted on Google's CDN servers for optimum performance.

data.name: plJQueryUseHosted.Help
data.value: If checked, then the associated URL will be used for the jQuery file. If unchecked then local copies of the file will be used.

data.name: plJQueryVersion.Help
data.value: Identifies the version string embedded in the local jQuery script.

data.name: plEnableCDN.Help
data.value: If checked, then the associated URL will be used for javascript libraries. If unchecked then local copies of the file will be used.

data.name: FrameworkDownLevel.Text
data.value: Note: You are running on an old version of the .NET Framework. Future upgrades of the DotNetNuke platform will require .NET 3.5 SP1 or later. If you believe you are running .NET 3.5 SP1 already, please check your web.config file and ensure that the 3.5 or above versions of both System.Core and System.Data.Linq are referenced in the assemblies node.

data.name: plBetaNotice.Help
data.value: Check this box to display a message indicating that the running version is a Beta release.

data.name: plThrowExceptions.Help
data.value: Check this to enable core exceptions that are due to missing fields in data returned from the database to be rethrown. If this is not checked the error is logged in the Event Log. If this is checked the error is bubbled up. This setting is primarily used for developers to diagnose problems.

data.name: plPsWarning.Text
data.value: Warning: Memory page state persistence can cause Ajax issues

data.name: ModuleCacheProvider.Help
data.value: Select the default module caching provider. This setting can be overridden by each individual module.

data.name: plContentLocalization.Help
data.value: Check this to enable passing the users current culture allowing for dynamic website and content localization

data.name: PageCacheProvider.Help
data.value: Select the default Page Caching Provider. The caching provider must be enabled by setting the cache timeout on each page.

data.name: plUseCustomModuleCssClass.Help
data.value: Check this option to enable a custom css class based on the module definition to be rendered. This can be used by skin designers to apply specific css styles to specific module types.

data.name: plEnableContentLocalization.Help
data.value: Check this box to allow site administrators to enable content localization for their site.

data.name: plJQueryUIHostUrl.Help
data.value: This is the full URL for the jQuery UI script. By default this is set to the latest jQuery UI minified script hosted on Google's CDN servers for optimum performance.

data.name: plJQueryUIVersion.Help
data.value: Identifies the version string embedded in the local jQuery UI script.

data.name: PreviewNoSelectionMessage.Text
data.value: Please select a skin and/or container to preview.

data.name: DeprecateGzip.Text
data.value: DotNetNuke's GZip compression is getting deprecated and removed in 6.2.0. We recommend using IIS compression to increase performance on your server.

data.name: plCrmVersion.Help
data.value: To manage browser caching, client resources are assigned a version number. This number is increased when an extension is installed, portal.css is updated, or when the server cache is cleared. It applies to any processed file (combined and/or minified). You can manually increase the number below to force browsers to download new copies of the resource files.

data.name: plCrmEnableCompositeFiles.Help
data.value: Composite files are combinations of resources (JavaScript and CSS) created to reduce the number of file requests by the browser. This will significantly increase the page loading speed.

data.name: plCrmMinifyCss.Help
data.value: CSS minification will reduce the size of the CSS code by using regular expressions to remove comments, whitespace and "dead css". It is only available when composite files are enabled.

data.name: plCrmMinifyJs.Help
data.value: JS minification will reduce the size of the JavaScript code using JSMin. It is only available when composite files are enabled.

data.name: IncrementCrmVersionConfirm.Text
data.value:
This action will force all site visitors to download new versions of CSS and JavaScript files. You should only do this if you are certain that the files have changed and you want those changes to be reflected on the client's browser.

Are you sure you want to increment the version number for your site?

data.name: IncrementCrmVersionError.Text
data.value: There was an error incrementing the Client Resource version.

data.name: DebugEnabled.Text
data.value: Debug mode is currently enabled at the application level (this is specified in the web.config file). This means that files will not be combined, even if file combining is enabled here or at the site level.

data.name: DebugEnabled.Title
data.value: Important note regarding application debug mode

data.name: MinificationSettingsInfo.Text
data.value: If minification settings are changed when composite files are enabled, you must first save the minification settings by clicking Update and then increment the version number. This will issue new composite files using the new minification settings.

data.name: IPFiltersDisabled.Text
data.value: Login IP filtering is current disabled. To enabled this please check the Enable IP address checking checkbox under Membership Management.

data.name: IPFiltersInfo.Text
data.value: When configuring IP addresses to filter, users cannot edit/delete an entry that would lock out their current IP address.

data.name: IPFiltersInfo.Title
data.value: Important note regarding IP Filtering settings

data.name: txtBatch.Text
data.value: Number of messages sent in each batch:

data.name: txtBatch.Help
data.value: The number of messages sent by the messaging scheduler in each batch.

data.name: SmtpServerWarning.Text
data.value: You are try to use a custom SMTP port with your install instance running under medium trust, you need contact your host provider to make sure this setting can work correctly on the server.

data.name: plLogs.Help
data.value: List of log files available to view

data.name: SelectLog.Text
data.value: Please select a log file to view

data.name: plBatch.Help
data.value: The number of messages sent by the messaging scheduler in each batch.

data.name: plBatch.Text
data.value: Number of messages sent in each batch:

data.name: plNumberPasswords.Help
data.value: Sets number of passwords to store for reuse check

data.name: plEnableBannedList.Help
data.value: Sets whether passwords are checked against a list of banned items

data.name: plEnableStrengthMeter.Help
data.value: Sets whether the password strength meter is shown on registration screen

data.name: plEnableIPChecking.Help
data.value: Sets whether IP address is checked during login

data.name: plMsAjaxCdn.Help
data.value: Enable CDN setting for Microsoft Ajax Library?

data.name: plTelerikBasicUrl.Help
data.value: Set the basic URL of Telerik CDN, it will use the files on Telerik server if you keep this field empty. you can see more from here.

data.name: plTelerikCdn.Help
data.value: Enable CDN settings for Telerik Controls?

data.name: plTelerikSecureUrl.Help
data.value: Set the secure URL of Telerik CDN, it will use the files on Telerik server if you keep this field empty. you can see more from here.

data.name: plAsyncTimeout.Help
data.value: Set a value that indicates the time, in seconds, before asynchronous postbacks time out if no response is received, the value should between 90-9999 seconds.

data.name: plEnablePasswordHistory.Help
data.value: Sets whether a list of recently used passwords is maintained and checked to prevent re-use.

data.name: plResetLinkValidity.Help
data.value: Password reset links are only valid for (in minutes).

data.name: valResetLink.Error
data.value: Reset link timeouts must be greater than 0

data.name: CharacterSubListLabel.Help
data.value: Select the character to use to concatenate URLs.

data.name: ExtensionLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the extension, including the period prefix. The default extension is .aspx.

data.name: plJQueryMigrateHostUrl.Help
data.value: This is the full URL for the jQuery migrate plugin. If this field is empty then it will continue to use the resource in website.

data.name: lblSearchIndexPath.Help
data.value: Location where Search Index is stored. This location can be manually changed by creating a Host Setting "Search_IndexFolder" in database. It is advised to stop App Pool prior to making this change. Content of old folder must be manually copied to new location also or manual re-index must be triggered.

data.name: MessageIndexWarning.Text
data.value: Compacting of Index reclaims space from deleted items in the Index Store. Compacting is recommended only when there are many 'Deleted Documents' in Index Store. Compacting may require twice the size of current Index Store during processing. Re-Indexing applies to content from Host pages only. Re-Index deletes existing content from the Index Store and then re-indexes everything. Both Compacting and Re-Indexing are done by Site Search Crawler scheduled job. Caution - Compacting or Re-Indexing should be done during non-peak hours as the process can be CPU intensive.

data.name: CompactIndexConfirmationMessage.Text
data.value: Compacting Index can be CPU consuming and may require twice the space of the current Index Store for processing. Compacting is done by site search crawler and depends on it's scheduling frequency. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: lblIndexWordMaxLength.Help
data.value: Enter the maximum word size to be included in the Index.

data.name: lblIndexWordMinLength.Help
data.value: Enter the minimum word size to be included in the Index.

data.name: lblSearchIndexActiveDocuments.Help
data.value: The number of active documents in search index files

data.name: lblSearchIndexDeletedDocuments.Help
data.value: The number of deleted documents in search index files

data.name: lblSearchIndexLastModifiedOn.Help
data.value: Last modified time of search index files

data.name: ReIndexConfirmationMessage.Text
data.value: Re-Index will cause existing content in the Index Store to be deleted. Re-index is done by search crawler(s) and depends on their scheduling frequency. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: valIndexWordMaxLengthCompare.Error
data.value: Must be integer that greater than min length

data.name: valIndexWordMaxLengthRequired.Error
data.value: Max length of index word is required

data.name: valIndexWordMinLengthCompare.Error
data.value: Must be integer that greater than 0

data.name: valIndexWordMinLengthRequired.Error
data.value: Min length of index word is required

data.name: lblSearchIndexDbSize.Help
data.value: The total size of search index database files

data.name: plDebugMode.Help
data.value: If checked the installation runs in "debug mode", meaning that various parts of the application will write more verbose error logs etc. Note this may lead to performance degradation.

data.name: plShowCriticalErrors.Help
data.value: This setting determines if error messages sent via the error querystring parameter should be shown inline in the page.
